byline.original: By MATTHEW ROSENBERG and JOHN MARKOFF

abstract: Pentagon has quietly been developing autonomous and semiautonomous weapons, placing artificial intelligence at center of plan to maintain United States' military supremacy; project, and parallel work by America's enemies, has alarmed scientists and activists concerned about implications of robot arms race.

keywords.value: United States Defense and Military Forces
keywords.name: subject

lead_paragraph: The United States has put artificial intelligence at the center of its defense strategy, with weapons that can identify targets and make decisions.
snippet: The United States has put artificial intelligence at the center of its defense strategy, with weapons that can identify targets and make decisions....

headline.main: The Pentagon’s ‘Terminator Conundrum’: Robots That Could Kill on Their Own
headline.print_headline: At Heart of U.S. Strategy, Weapons That Can Think
